answers.answer: I don't know much about this, but it looks like you're not alone and that it can be rather common to have post partum hypertention.  check out these links and see if you think they apply.  good luck!http://my.americanheart.org/jiveforum/thread.jspa?threadID=3683&tstart=0There's also some articles on post partum pre-eclampsia...http://findarticles.com/p/articles/mi_m0CYD/is_24_37/ai_95792138/http://pregnancy.emedtv.com/preeclampsia/postpartum-preeclampsia.htmlDefinitely keep an eye this and remember that your bp is most accurate when you are just waking up or have been resting for a while.  I would start taking your bp at different times and keeping a journal of what the bp levels were and if there was any activity prior to taking the bp etc so the docs have something to go on.  Also keep an eye on the swelling.  If you start gaining water weight that's something you'll want looked at too.  Good luck!

Your doctors advise is pretty much spot on.  The only thing i can add is to watch out for severe headaches unrelieved by Tylenol, or right upper quadrant abdominal pain.Either symptom, in light of ANY increased BP, should be promptly investigated.The farther out you get from delivery, the less worrisome your BP is as a symptom of pregnancy induced hypertension.Be aware, though, that hypertension in general may become sustained at any time.  Women who have elevated BP's during pregnancy or for 6-8 weeks after, have an increased risk of having sustained hypertension at some point in their lives.

my bp was only taken at the hosp and if i didnt take my pain meds (stubborn ol me) it did creep up.  the nurses told me to stop being stubborn and take them and low and behold it went down lol.  hopefully it will go down soon and you wont have to worry.  how long is your dr in africa?

I just wanted to let you know it is possible to get eclampsia. Same symptoms as pre eclampsia but after birth. I had this with my first on day 4 my bp skyrocketed and I got very nausous legs swelling. I had also never had a problem with bp in my pregnancy. The dr got my bp under control kept me in for another few days and when It was ok then they let me go home.

I had very dangerously high BP after I delivered Brody. I was hospitalized overnight. I was very scared. Just wanted you to know it happened to me and I am praying it doesn't happen again. I was miserable. Good luck.
no higher today so far... 130/86. I'll just keep watching it

following the birth of my first child, my BP did not go down, and continued to creep up for about 6 weeks or so...  my OB did end up putting me on some BP medication... (I also had hypertension with both pregnancies)...  eventually it went back to normal, but it did take probably 6 months for it to level out completely....  with my second, I had the hypertension at the end of the pregnancy-  OB delivered at 37 weeks because it was so high...  but immediately after his birth, it was normal again...  so....  I guess it is just something you'll have to watch.

My swelling actually increased along w/my bp.  I thought the same thing - that it was normal post-partum occurence but when my shoes still didn't fit or got worse, I contacted my doctor and was immediately referred to a cardiologist for tests.  If your bp continues this way or rises or your swelling continues, I would contact your doctor to let them know.  usually it's nothing but from what I understand, there's some kind of complication that involves the heart that can happen.your blood pressure doesn't sound too bad though but watch your swelling.  Mine was in my feet/ankles as well.  I ended up on Lasiks (direutic) for a little while.

question: Does anyone know if it's normal for blood pressure to go up after delivery? I had dd a week ago via c-section. My BP during this pregnancy has been great and low, although i do have a history of preeclampsia in my previous pregnancy. Towards the end of the pregnancy it did creep up slightly, but was still well within normal. i think it went as high as 125/80 while pregnany. My BP when not pregnant is also normally nice and low- 110/60. While in the hospital, it had returned to normal.Yesterday I noticed swelling in my feet so I took my BP. it was 130/83- higher than it had been during my entire pregnancy. Today my highest reading was 131/92.While these numbers are high for me, I am aware that in general, they are not considered too high. My OB is vacation, and the covering dr is far from me. Since he doesn't know me, I know he wouldn't be concerned. When i was pregnant, I asked my OB what BP should get me worried. He said that as long as the bottom number was under 100, there was nothing to worry about. I am assuming the same applies to post partum. Therefore, I'm taking a wait and see approach. My OB did warn me that swelling can last several weeks, but I don't know if it's normal for BP to slowly creep up. For anyone who tracks their BP, did you notice an increase post partum??
title: blood pressure post partum
